This system's behavior under temporal evolution is governed by \\( \\dot{z} = Cz \\) where C is another constant matrix.

Given \\( z(T) \\), is it possible to determine whether \\( h(z) \\) was applied at t = 0 or if \\( z_0 \\) was simply subjected to \\( \\dot{z} = Cz \\) without knowledge of the use of \\( h(z) \\)?
Explanation: Without knowing if \\( h(z) \\) was applied, the subsequent evolution under \\( \\dot{z} = Cz \\) obscures whether the complex integration effected by A, B, and i was the initial condition, especially considering that complex exponentials and differentials don't easily reverse infer.
